articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday there could be no permanent ceasefire in Gaza until Hamas was destroyed, casting doubt on a key part of a truce proposal that U.S. President Joe Biden said Israel itself had made.
articles.title: Netanyahu says no Gaza ceasefire until Hamas destroyed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The vote share of South Africa's governing African National Congress (ANC) after this week's parliamentary election slipped further to just over 40% with results in from almost all polling stations, the electoral commission's website showed on Saturday.
articles.title: South Africa latest vote count puts ANC just over 40%

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party-led alliance is projected to win a majority in the general election that concluded on Saturday, an exit poll summary by the NDTV news channel said.
articles.title: TV exit poll summary projects victory for Indian PM Modi in general election

articles.author: Idrees Ali
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin tried to refocus attention on China's threat in the Pacific on Saturday, seeking to alleviate concerns that conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza have distracted from America's security commitments in Asia.
articles.title: U.S. defense chief refocuses attention on China security risks

articles.author: Nelson Renteria
articles.description: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele is set to be inaugurated for a second term on Saturday, as his sky-high approval rating for a fierce crackdown on crime faces fresh challenges to rejuvenate a stagnant economy and tackle poverty in the Central American country.
articles.title: El Salvador's Bukele starts second term amid economic test

articles.author: Joey Roulette, Steve Gorman
articles.description: Boeing's new Starliner astronaut capsule is poised for launch on Saturday in a much-delayed first crewed test flight, a milestone in the beleaguered aerospace giant's aim to compete with Elon Musk's SpaceX in the astronaut launch business.
articles.title: Boeing's Starliner capsule set for launch of first crewed space flight

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: Russia launched a barrage of missiles and drones on Saturday that damaged energy facilities and critical infrastructure across Ukraine, injuring at least four people, and prompting President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to issue a fresh plea for more air defence assistance.
articles.title: Russia pounds Ukraine's energy sector, Kyiv urges more air defence assistance

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Helen Coster, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Donald Trump said on Friday he would appeal the guilty verdict that made him the first U.S. president convicted of a crime, though he will have to wait until after his sentencing on July 11 before taking that step.
articles.title: Trump says he will appeal historic conviction

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rainbow flags filled the streets of Bangkok on Saturday at the start of Pride Month as Thailand inches closer to recognising same-sex marriages.
articles.title: Thai LGBT community start Pride Month ahead of marriage equality bill readings

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: The next European Parliament should copy the current Italian model of government, drawing together all parties on the right of the political spectrum to rule together, Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said on Saturday.
articles.title: EU parliament should look to Rome for inspiration, Meloni tells rally
